text: Sound Transit (ST), officially the Central Puget Sound Regional Transit Authority, is the public transit system in Seattle, Washington, United States. It covers Seattle and its neighboring cities with light rail trains, commuter trains, and buses. Sound Transit gets its money from sales tax, property tax, and a fee on license plate stickers ("car tabs"). == References == == Other websites == * Category:1990s establishments in Washington (state) Category:1993 establishments in the United States Category:Rapid transit systems in the United States Category:Transport in Washington (state)
title: Sound Transit
